intro: Schkuhria abrotanifolia, commonly known as the Mexican thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind. Schkuhria abrotanifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
